questions.question: What is 'Autopay' in modern banking?
options: A robot that pays for your groceries
A system that automatically pays bills on the due date
A way to print your own money
A manual bank transfer made at a branch
questions.explanation: Autopay es un sistema que paga automáticamente las facturas en la fecha de vencimiento.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly expresses a future intention?
options: I am going set up a direct debit.
I going to set up a direct debit.
I am going to set up a direct debit.
I am go to set up a direct debit.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es: be + going to + verbo base.

questions.question: What does 'Paperless Billing' mean?
options: Paying with physical cash
Receiving statements digitally instead of on paper
Having no money in the bank
Writing checks by hand
questions.explanation: La facturación sin papel (paperless) significa recibir estados de cuenta digitalmente.

questions.question: If a payment is 'Overdue', it means:
options: It was paid too early
The amount is too high
It was not paid by the due date
It is a free service
questions.explanation: Un pago 'overdue' es aquel que no se realizó antes de la fecha límite.

questions.question: Choose the correct negative form:
options: They not going to cancel the subscription.
They aren't going to cancel the subscription.
They don't going to cancel the subscription.
They isn't going to cancel the subscription.
questions.explanation: El negativo para 'they' es 'are not' (aren't).

questions.question: What is a 'Subscription' service?
options: A one-time purchase of a car
A regular payment for access to a product or service
A government tax on income
A physical signature on a document
questions.explanation: Una suscripción es un pago regular por el acceso a un servicio.

questions.question: What does a 'Smart Meter' do?
options: It measures how fast you walk
It automatically records and sends energy usage to providers
It counts the physical coins in your wallet
It translates bank documents into different languages
questions.explanation: Un medidor inteligente registra y envía el consumo de energía automáticamente.

questions.question: Correct the question: 'Is you going to pay the bill?'
options: Am you going to pay the bill?
Are you going to pay the bill?
Do you going to pay the bill?
Is you go to pay the bill?
questions.explanation: Se usa 'are' con el pronombre 'you'.

questions.question: What is a 'Billing Cycle'?
options: A bicycle used by bank employees
The interval between two consecutive billing statements
The time it takes to print a physical check
A type of recurring loan
questions.explanation: Un ciclo de facturación es el intervalo entre dos estados de cuenta.

questions.question: Which of these is a 'Recurring Payment'?
options: Buying a coffee once
A monthly rent payment
Selling an old phone
Finding a $20 bill on the street
questions.explanation: El alquiler mensual es un pago recurrente.

questions.question: Complete the intention: 'We ______ to switch to green energy.'
options: is going
are going
am going
be going
questions.explanation: Con 'we' usamos el verbo 'are'.

questions.question: What is 'VAT'?
options: Virtual Account Technology
Value Added Tax
Verified Asset Transfer
Variable Annual Time
questions.explanation: VAT es el impuesto al valor agregado (IVA).

questions.question: Identify the grammatically correct sentence:
options: He's going to monitoring his expenses.
He's going to monitor his expenses.
He going to monitor his expenses.
He's go to monitor his expenses.
questions.explanation: Sujeto + be + going to + verbo base (monitor).

questions.question: What is a 'Utility'?
options: A set of tools for home repair
Basic services like water, gas, and electricity
The profit made from an investment
A type of high-interest savings account
questions.explanation: Utilities son los servicios básicos como agua, gas y electricidad.

questions.question: In the sentence 'I'm going to pay by app', what is the intention?
options: Past action
Future plan
Habitual action
Prohibition
questions.explanation: 'Going to' indica un plan o intención futura.

questions.question: If you cancel a subscription, are you ______ to pay next month?
options: not going
going not
no going
not go
questions.explanation: La forma negativa es 'not going to'.

questions.question: What should you do if a bill amount is 'incorrect'?
options: Pay it immediately anyway
Ignore it and wait for a fine
Contact the provider to dispute the error
Close your bank account
questions.explanation: Si el monto es incorrecto, debes contactar al proveedor para reclamar el error.

questions.question: Correct the error: 'I going pay my bills today.'
options: I am going to pay my bills today.
I going to pay my bills today.
I am go pay my bills today.
I go pay my bills today.
questions.explanation: Falta el verbo 'to be' (am) y la preposición 'to'.

questions.question: What is a 'receipt'?
options: A document showing a payment was made
A request for more money
A type of bank card
A loan application form
questions.explanation: Un recibo es un documento que demuestra que se realizó un pago.

questions.question: Which adverb is often used with 'going to' for intentions?
options: Yesterday
Next week
Last year
Already
questions.explanation: 'Next week' (la próxima semana) se usa para planes futuros.
